explanation: Funds are required to assess COVID-19 testing capability for the operational Army force. Armny training and operations during COVID-19 require a fast and efficient testing process to potentially minimize operational disruptions. These funds will be used to evaluate the viability and reliability of two systems for COVID-19 testing in operations settings: GeneXpert Omni Point of Care and Cue Health. Operational evaluation of these systems will assess viability for addressing point-of-care testing gaps within | the Joint Services. Highly sensitive point of care diagnostic testbed is expected to provide results in

Funds are required for Subsistence In Kind (SIK) due to the increased requirement from Restriction of Movement associated with recruit training and overseas moves for items such as MREs, BAS policy exceptions, and changes to meal provisioning. This isa CARES Act division B, Title III, requirement.

Funds are available based on increased use of Army National Guard (ARNG) service members for additional FEMA Mission Assignments and the use of base MILPERS appropriated funds to support COVID-19 costs. This is CARES Act division B, Title II, funding.
